poem.title: Dorics
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: We've got falls to write about; they don't: They thought up fauns: viagra with the hoofs and horns of bambi. Whoever faas is deid, no drunk. Their flaws are divinely crafted. It's slaves the guidwife flogs, not wedding china. Frogs are frogs: they don't get pawned for princes. Passion fogs the reason, not the glasses. The last act hits the hero, however he fobs it off, Whereas, here, a lawyer foils the fates like chicken If you pay so. Their forms are platonic; ours are electronic.
